programme.desc: Kentucky and Kansas both boast unbelievable turkey hunting opportunities, and when some good friends and turkey camp are mixed in, turkey season is hard to beat.

programme.title: Wild Strongholds
programme.desc: Mongolia Wild Strongholds travels to Mongolia in search of Hangai argali and maral stag and studies the impact that domestic animals have on the wildlife.

programme.title: Night Crew
programme.sub-title: The Life of an Undeserving Son
programme.desc: Calling pigs with lights from the ground. Look out, here they come!

programme.title: Waterfowl Obsession
programme.desc: As the days shorten and the temps drop, the Waterfowl Obsession crew experiences some stellar October hunts and bumps along the road.

programme.title: Heartland Waterfowl
programme.desc: Some of the HW guys head back to Wyoming to hunt and spend many hours in the pit blind with good friend Aaron Garcia of High Plains Wingshooting.

programme.title: The Ultimate Fishing Experience
programme.desc: We join Tony Roach, son Robbie and father Mark on Lake Mille Lacs fishing out of the newly reintroduced Lund Fisherman for Walleye and Smallmouth Bass.

programme.title: In Fisherman TV
programme.desc: It's some of the most spectacular footage in all of fishing, as the In-Fisherman staff fine-tunes tackle and technique to sight fish for shallow smallmouth bass; heads shallow again for walleyes tucked in heavy weedgrowth under crystal clear skies.

programme.title: Jarrett Edwards Outdoors
programme.desc: Jarrett teams up with Jared Lintner on Clear Lake in California.

programme.title: The Bearded Buck
programme.desc: Join the Sharp brothers as they head to the great state of Texas to hunt whitetails in the hill country.

programme.title: Mountain Top Outdoors
programme.desc: Butch Bauer from Working Man BowHunter travels down to Killbuck, Ohio for his fourth consecutive year chasing whiteails for an early season archery hunt.

programme.title: Winchester & Drury's Natural Born
programme.desc: Three seasoned whitetail hunters find success in three different states.

programme.title: Backyard Ballistics
programme.desc: Jörg and Cheyenne are challenged to build a Flaming Ballista. Jörg's eyes light up at the very prospect and schools us about the historical evolution of siege weaponry.

programme.title: Handguns & Defensive Weapons
programme.desc: Rich and Jim dive into team tactics -- what a team is, how to communicate and how to work as a team. Jim runs a plate rack drill, and in En Garde, Rich demonstrates strike-and-shoot defensive techniques.

programme.title: Shooting Gallery
programme.sub-title: Secrets of Concealed Carry With SCCY Firearms
programme.desc: Dianna Muller and Iain Harrison join Michael Bane in spelling out the secrets of concealed carry while showcasing the handguns from SCCY.

programme.title: Two Conchs Sports Fishing TV
programme.desc: Tucker Carlson and JC Carlson head to Lake Ida in Delray Beach, Florida. The boys fish with Capt. Bill Lepree and experience epic fishing for largemouth and peacock bass.

programme.title: Into the Blue
programme.desc: Capt. Scott Walker and Capt. Steve Rodger head out on a windy day on the reef edge off Key West.

programme.title: Target rich environment
programme.desc: Brett and Charles talk Craig into a duck hunt after a long night of thermal hunting.

programme.title: Dropped
programme.desc: Chris and Casey Keefer must push to reach the LZ, with a failing raft. With only a few hours before extraction, will Mother Nature get the best of them before they can get to safety?

programme.title: The Wild, Wild West
programme.sub-title: The Night of the Returning Dead
programme.desc: Gordon and West ask help from a man who controls animals with his mind; guests Peter Lawford, Sammy Davis Jr.

programme.title: A Man Called Sledge
programme.desc: Two outlaws (James Garner, Dennis Weaver) stage a prison break to steal a fortune in gold dust guarded by the Army.

programme.title: Ace High
programme.desc: Bounty hunters (Terence Hill, Brock Peters) chase an outlaw (Eli Wallach) who beat them to a reward offered for a bank robber.

programme.title: Man of the East
programme.desc: A dude (Terence Hill) arrives from New England with books and a bicycle, ready to claim his father's rowdy ranch.

programme.title: Another Man, Another Chance
programme.desc: Jeanne falls for Francis, and he convinces her to leave war-torn France and move to America. A few years later Francis dies, then Jeanne meets David, a widower, and the two find love again.

programme.title: The Jane Austen Book Club
programme.desc: In a book club devoted to the author's works, several people (Maria Bello, Amy Brenneman, Emily Blunt) discover that their own lives closely parallel themes found in Austen's prose.

programme.title: Empire Records
programme.desc: A frustrated record-store manager (Anthony LaPaglia) dreams of owning the business, then an employee (Rory Cochrane) gambles away his down payment.

programme.title: Jericho
programme.desc: A charismatic preacher rescues a mysterious gunman who tries to find the answers to his lost identity.

programme.title: Stop! Or My Mom Will Shoot
programme.desc: A Los Angeles policeman (Sylvester Stallone) has his little mother (Estelle Getty) from New Jersey for a partner, whether he likes it or not.

programme.title: Necessary Roughness
programme.desc: An over-30 ex-quarterback (Scott Bakula) gets to play as a freshman on a wild-card team at a Texas college.

programme.title: The Grudge
programme.desc: An American exchange student (Sarah Michelle Gellar) and her boyfriend (Jason Behr) encounter vengeful spirits that haunt a house in Tokyo.

programme.title: Blind Date
programme.desc: A Los Angeles bachelor (Bruce Willis) attends a company dinner with a stranger (Kim Basinger) who gets silly when she drinks.

programme.title: Ed
programme.desc: The team mascot, a chimp, reverses the fortunes of a struggling minor-league pitcher (Matt LeBlanc) and his losing squad.

programme.title: The Woman in Green
programme.desc: Sherlock Holmes (Basil Rathbone) and Dr. Watson (Nigel Bruce) follow Moriarty's trail to a hypnotist called Lydia (Hillary Brooke).

programme.title: Megan Leavey
programme.desc: Young Marine Cpl. Megan Leavey starts to identify with Rex, a particularly aggressive combat dog that she trains. Together, they complete more than 100 missions until an improvised explosive device injures both, putting their fates in jeopardy.

programme.title: Miss Pettigrew Lives for a Day
programme.desc: A middle-aged British governess (Frances McDormand) gets a taste of the glamorous life when she takes a job as the caretaker of an American celebrity (Amy Adams).

programme.title: Streets of Laredo
programme.desc: Ex-Texas Ranger Capt. Woodrow Call is hired by a railroad company to track down an elusive Mexican bandit.

programme.title: Reality Bites
programme.desc: An aspiring filmmaker (Winona Ryder) follows the paths of her friends after they graduate from college in Texas.

programme.title: Joe and Max
programme.desc: Joe Louis (Leonard Roberts) fights German boxer Max Schmeling (Til Schweiger) and forms a friendship with him outside the ring.

programme.title: Bogus
programme.desc: An unlikely foster mother (Whoopi Goldberg) bonds with a boy (Haley Joel Osment) and his imaginary friend, a Frenchman called Bogus (Gérard Depardieu).

programme.title: Tremors 2: Aftershocks
programme.desc: The Mexican government hires two handymen (Fred Ward, Michael Gross) to battle huge man-eating worms plaguing an oil field.

programme.title: Tremors 3: Back to Perfection
programme.desc: Mutated graboids return to feast on the residents of Perfection, threatening its new status as a tourist attraction.

programme.title: Tremors 4: The Legend Begins
programme.desc: A man (Michael Gross) hires a mercenary to destroy gigantic worms that are terrorizing a mining town in the 1800s.

programme.title: Tremors: A Cold Day in Hell
programme.desc: Burt Gummer suspects that giant worms are being utilized as weapons at a research facility in Canada. He soon finds himself in a race against time to create an antidote from one of the creature's venom to save his own life.

programme.title: Denial
programme.desc: Writer David Irving (Timothy Spall) wages a legal battle against historian Deborah Lipstadt (Rachel Weisz) after she accuses him of denying the Holocaust.

programme.title: Open Season 3
programme.desc: After Boog switches places with a circus bear, Elliott and the gang must rescue him before the circus returns home to Russia. Animated.

programme.title: 28 Days
programme.desc: When a court order sends a New York journalist (Sandra Bullock) to a rehabilitation center for substance abusers, she meets a ballplayer.

programme.title: The Grandmaster
programme.desc: The story of the martial arts master (Tony Leung Chiu Wai) who taught the Wing Chun style of kung fu to Bruce Lee.

programme.title: Babe
programme.desc: An Australian farmer (James Cromwell) adopts a piglet that becomes a champion sheepherder. Live action/animatronics.

programme.title: The Importance of Being Earnest
programme.desc: Complications arise after two bachelors (Rupert Everett, Colin Firth) make use of the same pseudonym in 19th-century England.

programme.title: Mr. Baseball
programme.desc: An aging New York Yankee (Tom Selleck) gets traded to a team in Japan and lets them all know how he feels about it.

programme.title: Little Boy
programme.desc: In 1940s California, a priest and a magician inspire a boy (Jakob Salvati) to do good works in the hope that God will recognize his strong faith and bring his father home from war.

programme.title: Stop! Or My Mom Will Shoot
programme.desc: A Los Angeles policeman (Sylvester Stallone) has his little mother (Estelle Getty) from New Jersey for a partner, whether he likes it or not.

programme.title: Food Factory
programme.desc: An all-American candy company makes 200,000 packages of red licorice every day; a zippy mayonnaise packs the punch of spicy Sriracha; 40,000 Turkish bourekas are produced every day; and Laceys feature a chocolate centre sandwiched between two wafer-thin cookies.

programme.title: Food Factory
programme.desc: 1.8 million cherry chews are produced from just one single batch; massive silos of wheat are transformed into 'elbow' macaroni pasta; a continental cranberry cheesecake first started as a Christmas experiment; and meet chakri, the exotic southeast Asian snack that's hand-twirled and fried to crispy perfection.

programme.title: Kenya Wildlife Diaries
programme.desc: Grevy's zebra populations are declining rapidly, putting the skittish animals on the endangered list. See what Lewa Conservancy is doing to protect the species, and how partner groups from around the world are lending their expertise to help.

programme.title: Wildlife Icons
programme.desc: The Nile crocodile and hippopotamus have coexisted for thousands of years, and are now amphibious icons of Africa. Take a close look at their lives on Ndumo Reserve, and how the creatures cope with the worst drought in a hundred years.

programme.title: Alien Abyss
programme.desc: Get acquainted with an array of ocean oddballs and learn how billions of years' worth of changes, from ice ages to asteroid strikes, have shaped their looks and skills. Meet blind worms who fish, walking sharks, tree-climbing crabs, and much more.

programme.title: Secrets Of Wild Australia
programme.desc: With more than 300 species, the snakes of Australia are as diverse and striking as the landscape they inhabit. Discover their clever hunting techniques, along with the ways their favourite prey, lizards, have evolved to outwit them.

programme.title: Secrets Of Wild Australia
programme.desc: Descended from the Asian wolf, dingoes have been in Australia for over three thousand years. As apex predators, they keep feral animal numbers in check, but the introduction of non-native sheep and cattle has caused them problems.

programme.title: Africa's Claws & Jaws
programme.desc: Sharks are among the planet's oldest and most highly evolved predators. Along the coast of southern Africa, pioneers dedicate their lives to learning more about these fascinating creatures and spreading awareness about their plight.

programme.title: Africa's Claws & Jaws
programme.desc: Lurking in the shadows of Africa is an incredible diversity of reptiles we seldom see. Masters of the underworld, these snakes and lizards have conquered almost every habitat on the continent while evolving a remarkable set of adaptations to survive.

programme.title: Shark Squad
programme.desc: Off Guadalupe Island, Mexico, top shark ecologist Mauricio Hoyos attempts a television first. Get a unique view as he attaches a camera to the dorsal fin of a great white, revealing how it swims, hunts, and ultimately strikes its prey.

programme.title: Shark Squad
programme.desc: Travel to a remote part of the Bahamas to unlock shark secrets. Do they make friends? Where do they give birth? Are some bolder than others? The answers may help protect these supreme predators for generations to come.

programme.title: Arabian Seas
programme.desc: Arabia's coral reefs are home to some of nature's most impressive illusionists. Creatures can pulsate with colour, transform in the blink of an eye, or perform riveting displays of showmanship. Because in these dangerous waters, disguise is crucial.

programme.title: Kenya Wildlife Diaries
programme.desc: Grevy's zebra populations are declining rapidly, putting the skittish animals on the endangered list. See what Lewa Conservancy is doing to protect the species, and how partner groups from around the world are lending their expertise to help.

programme.title: Kenya Wildlife Diaries
programme.desc: Grevy's zebra populations are declining rapidly, putting the skittish animals on the endangered list. See what Lewa Conservancy is doing to protect the species, and how partner groups from around the world are lending their expertise to help.

programme.title: Strange Creatures
programme.desc: Gawk at some of the world's ugliest animals who owe their survival to the adaptations that made them so strange. A pudgy wolf eel, naked mole rat, and hideous sea lamprey may be superficially grotesque, but they're evolutionarily amazing.

programme.title: Strange Creatures
programme.desc: Witness the tiny creatures that make us squirm while hiding admirable survival skills. From playing dead, removing a tail, or being able to lift objects 30 times their weight, these insects conquer the world with their amazing adaptations.

programme.title: Macro Worlds
programme.desc: Enter a rarely seen world of insect terror, where brutal death, vicious fights, and last-minute rescues abound. In this ordinary setting, discover enemies and murderers, friendly encounters, and a little romance.

programme.title: Macro Worlds
programme.desc: Meet the most successful order of animals on the planet through close-up, slow-motion shots. Discover the hidden yet fascinating behaviour of domestic beetles, which have inhabited the earth for more than 240 million years.

programme.title: Wildlife Icons
programme.desc: The Nile crocodile and hippopotamus have coexisted for thousands of years, and are now amphibious icons of Africa. Take a close look at their lives on Ndumo Reserve, and how the creatures cope with the worst drought in a hundred years.

programme.title: Alien Abyss
programme.desc: Get acquainted with an array of ocean oddballs and learn how billions of years' worth of changes, from ice ages to asteroid strikes, have shaped their looks and skills. Meet blind worms who fish, walking sharks, tree-climbing crabs, and much more.

programme.title: Coastal Africa
programme.desc: On the rocky southern tip of Africa lies a narrow peninsula held hostage by the elements. From pounding ice-cold waves to relentless sun, see how extreme conditions demand toughness and adaptability from its resident wildlife.

programme.title: Coastal Africa
programme.desc: Beneath the warm waters of the Indian Ocean lies a sanctuary filled with dazzling aquatic life. From witnessing a nesting turtle's journey to meeting fish-cleaning shrimp, embark on a grand adventure into this amazing marine wilderness.

programme.title: Nature Scenes
programme.desc: One half hour of uninterrupted aerial footage of the beautiful Lake Powell.

programme.title: Strange Creatures
programme.desc: Are they guinea pigs, beavers, or something else? Capybaras embody the features of several different animals at once, as do warthogs, anteaters, and other fascinating genetic hybrids. Learn why these wannabes display such particular physical traits.

programme.title: Strange Creatures
programme.desc: The animal kingdom is filled with mimicry, transformation, and trickery. Discover how stick bugs, lion fish, emperor scorpions, and chameleons use camouflage and confusion to deceive.

programme.title: Arabian Seas
programme.desc: Off the coast of Oman, summer weather drives nutrients in from the ocean depths where they meet the Arabian sun, causing an explosion of life. Smaller fish spawn, filling the waters with eggs. This creates a buffet predators just can't resist.

programme.title: Kenya Wildlife Diaries
programme.desc: Uncover one of the biggest issues in African conservation: the growing human population. See how the battle for land creates unintended conflicts between humans and animals, and what Lewa staff do to cope in the short term.

programme.title: Shadowlands
programme.desc: Experience unbelievable acts of courage and loyalty by creatures trying to survive in the remote wilderness of New Zealand's South Island. Face forest penguins' feast and famine cycles, and explore the tumultuous world of newborn sea lions.

programme.title: Alien Abyss
programme.desc: Feel the love in the strange-but-heartwarming partnerships between some of Earth's oddest creatures. Dive deep to see strange animals, from snapping shrimp to wolf eels, offer a hand to their fellow ocean-going weirdos to ensure mutual survival.

programme.title: Coastal Africa
programme.desc: On the rocky southern tip of Africa lies a narrow peninsula held hostage by the elements. From pounding ice-cold waves to relentless sun, see how extreme conditions demand toughness and adaptability from its resident wildlife.

programme.title: Great Blue Wild
programme.desc: Researcher Andrea Marshall believes Mozambique-based manta rays may be attending the sardine run on South Africa's Wild Coast. The question is: why? Follow researchers as they track the creatures to understand their unusual migrating patterns.

programme.title: Great Blue Wild
programme.desc: Mozambique's coastline is home to an array of marine life, but no species is safe from overfishing. Join the region's leading researchers on their journey to find and understand one of the ocean's most secretive creatures, before it's too late.

programme.desc: Feel the love in the strange-but-heartwarming partnerships between some of Earth's oddest creatures. Dive deep to see strange animals, from snapping shrimp to wolf eels, offer a hand to their fellow ocean-going weirdos to ensure mutual survival.

programme.title: Great Blue Wild
programme.desc: Researcher Andrea Marshall believes Mozambique-based manta rays may be attending the sardine run on South Africa's Wild Coast. The question is: why? Follow researchers as they track the creatures to understand their unusual migrating patterns.

programme.title: Great Blue Wild
programme.desc: Mozambique's coastline is home to an array of marine life, but no species is safe from overfishing. Join the region's leading researchers on their journey to find and understand one of the ocean's most secretive creatures, before it's too late.

programme.title: Arabian Seas
programme.desc: Off the coast of Oman, summer weather drives nutrients in from the ocean depths where they meet the Arabian sun, causing an explosion of life. Smaller fish spawn, filling the waters with eggs. This creates a buffet predators just can't resist.

programme.title: Kenya Wildlife Diaries
programme.desc: Uncover one of the biggest issues in African conservation: the growing human population. See how the battle for land creates unintended conflicts between humans and animals, and what Lewa staff do to cope in the short term.

programme.title: Strange Creatures
programme.desc: Are they guinea pigs, beavers, or something else? Capybaras embody the features of several different animals at once, as do warthogs, anteaters, and other fascinating genetic hybrids. Learn why these wannabes display such particular physical traits.

programme.title: Strange Creatures
programme.desc: The animal kingdom is filled with mimicry, transformation, and trickery. Discover how stick bugs, lion fish, emperor scorpions, and chameleons use camouflage and confusion to deceive.

programme.title: Coastal Africa
programme.desc: On the rocky southern tip of Africa lies a narrow peninsula held hostage by the elements. From pounding ice-cold waves to relentless sun, see how extreme conditions demand toughness and adaptability from its resident wildlife.

programme.title: Coastal Africa
programme.desc: Beneath the warm waters of the Indian Ocean lies a sanctuary filled with dazzling aquatic life. From witnessing a nesting turtle's journey to meeting fish-cleaning shrimp, embark on a grand adventure into this amazing marine wilderness.

programme.title: Shadowlands
programme.desc: Experience unbelievable acts of courage and loyalty by creatures trying to survive in the remote wilderness of New Zealand's South Island. Face forest penguins' feast and famine cycles, and explore the tumultuous world of newborn sea lions.

programme.title: Alien Abyss
programme.desc: Feel the love in the strange-but-heartwarming partnerships between some of Earth's oddest creatures. Dive deep to see strange animals, from snapping shrimp to wolf eels, offer a hand to their fellow ocean-going weirdos to ensure mutual survival.

programme.title: Great Blue Wild
programme.desc: Researcher Andrea Marshall believes Mozambique-based manta rays may be attending the sardine run on South Africa's Wild Coast. The question is: why? Follow researchers as they track the creatures to understand their unusual migrating patterns.

programme.title: Great Blue Wild
programme.desc: Mozambique's coastline is home to an array of marine life, but no species is safe from overfishing. Join the region's leading researchers on their journey to find and understand one of the ocean's most secretive creatures, before it's too late.

programme.title: Nature Scenes
programme.desc: One half hour of uninterrupted footage of a cute and cuddly margay kitten sleeping, eating and enjoying some quality time with its beautiful mom. Animals filmed in captivity at Nicaragua's Fazoonic.

programme.title: Baby Animals
programme.desc: Elephants, gorillas, rhinos, and bison are among the largest and most imposing land-dwelling mammals, but they all start out as helpless infants. See how babies from each species find their way to becoming giants.

programme.title: Baby Animals
programme.desc: Not all infants in the animal kingdom get to have a good mother. But these are the stories of the lucky ones, from a ring-tailed lemur who learns everything from its mom to a tiny orangutan that receives a constant supply of motherly cuddles.

programme.title: Arabian Seas
programme.desc: It's summer in the Gulf of Oman. The scorching Arabian sun heats the shallow waters to 86 degrees boosting the growth of algae across a vast coral reef. This attracts thousands of hungry herbivores creating a fish versus fish turf war.

programme.title: Kenya Wildlife Diaries
programme.desc: Kenya takes a major step towards creating the country's first community-run rhino sanctuary. Find out why Lewa considers this the right move, and witness teams move rhinos from across the country to this new conservancy.

programme.title: Shadowlands
programme.desc: Learn how winter's arrival triggers animal survival instincts in southwestern New Zealand. Track dolphins as they move to warmer waters to give their calves a fighting chance, and join longfin eels on an epic migration to their spawning grounds.

programme.title: Alien Abyss
programme.desc: Channel your inner sci-fi fan and explore the bizarre mating rituals of the ocean's most peculiar creatures. Learn how bloody battles for mates, gender bending, and supersize litters of babies just might secure a next generation for these animals.

programme.title: Great Blue Wild
programme.desc: Researcher Andrea Marshall believes Mozambique-based manta rays may be attending the sardine run on South Africa's Wild Coast. The question is: why? Follow researchers as they track the creatures to understand their unusual migrating patterns.

programme.title: Alien Abyss

programme.title: Malawi Wildlife Rescue
programme.desc: Join Amanda on a white knuckle bush-whacking adventure to rescue a waterbuck caught by a poacher's snare. Meanwhile, the centre's resident hyena is treated for flea bitten ears and Alma gets a mysterious late night monkey delivery.

programme.title: Malawi Wildlife Rescue
programme.desc: See Amanda and Sophie push boundaries to get a vervet monkey with a broken leg back into the wild, the team is challenged when collaring a four tonne elephant. Alma receives an orphaned, cat-like genet and an antisocial baboon rejoins a troop.

programme.title: Nature Scenes
programme.desc: Half an hour of uninterrupted forest scenics. Experience Canada's fall colours at Ontario's Rouge Park.

programme.title: Baby Animals
programme.desc: Watch fur seals give birth by the thousands, black bear cubs wrestle with their buddies, and meerkat pups forge bonds by sharing chores-all proving that growing up in the animal kingdom is easier when you have numbers on your side.

programme.title: Baby Animals
programme.desc: Infancy isn't all fun and games. Some animals must hit the ground running to avoid becoming dinner for predators. Take an in-depth look at what life is like for newborn animals that must learn fast your die young.

programme.title: Arabian Seas
programme.desc: The sea turtle is one of the oldest animals on earth. These ancient mariners even pre-date the dinosaurs. They have existed, relatively unchanged, for over 100 million years. But now, all seven of the surviving species are endangered.

programme.title: How Do They Do It? (S5)
programme.desc: Discover the secrets to manufacturing mirrors and making a 2D design that wraps perfectly around a 3D car.

programme.title: How It's Made (S9)
programme.desc: Find out how Underwater Robots, Lasagna, Band Saws, and Ski Trekking Poles are made.

programme.title: The Explosion Show (S1)

programme.title: How Do They Do It? (S8)
programme.desc: How do they persuade an oyster to grow a perfect pearl; how do they put the twist in classic Pennsylvania pretzels; and how do they build Venice's traditional gondolas?
